Homemade Beauty Products: Another option is to create homemade beauty products using everyday household items. For example, using a mixture of sugar, honey, and water can create a gentle exfoliating scrub for the face and body. A mixture of yogurt and turmeric can be used as a face mask to help reduce inflammation and improve skin tone.

DIY Hair Care: Hair care can be maintained by using natural ingredients such as apple cider vinegar, coconut oil, and aloe vera. Apple cider vinegar can be used as a natural hair conditioner and can help reduce frizz and improve shine. Coconut oil can be used as a deep conditioning treatment to help nourish and strengthen hair. Aloe vera can be used as a leave-in conditioner to help detangle and reduce breakage.

Essential Oils: Essential oils can be used to maintain personal grooming habits. They can be used to create a natural perfume or deodorant. For example, a blend of lavender, peppermint, and tea tree oil can be used as a natural deodorant. Essential oils can also be used to create a natural hair care routine.

Herbal Teas: Herbal teas can be used to maintain personal grooming habits. For example, chamomile tea can be used as a natural facial mask to help reduce inflammation and improve skin tone. Green tea can be used as a natural anti-aging treatment to help reduce fine lines and wrinkles.

Sustainable Makeup: If cosmetic products were to disappear, one could turn to sustainable makeup options. For example, using a natural mineral foundation can help reduce the impact on the environment. Natural lipsticks made from plant-based ingredients can be used to maintain personal grooming habits.
